summary: SunCoke Energy, Inc. operates as an independent producer of coke in the Americas and Brazil. It operates through three segments: Domestic Coke, Brazil Coke, and Logistics. It offers metallurgical and thermal coal. The company also provides export and domestic material handling and/or mixing services to steel, coke, electric utility, coal producing, and other manufacturing-based customers. In addition, it owns and operates cokemaking facilities in the United States and Brazil. SunCoke Energy, Inc. was founded in 1960 and is headquartered in Lisle, Illinois.

business_segments.name: Domestic Coke
business_segments.description: Produces high-quality coke primarily used in the steelmaking process.

business_segments.name: Logistics
business_segments.description: Provides handling and mixing services for coal, coke, and other materials.

strategy.sustainability: SunCoke Energy focuses on reducing emissions, promoting safety, and supporting local communities through various sustainability initiatives.
market_risks: Fluctuations in steel demand can impact the demand for coke.
Regulatory changes related to emissions and environmental policies could affect operations.
